**Innate**.

messages.content: mid blast
mind blast is pretty mid outside of endless meme
Mind blast is mid
Unless yiu wanns be acsilly jokester
Mind blast would be better if the only reliable way to get one wasn't spending the cost of a relic at a shop
Lee's waffle, watching as i pick mind blast over it (im at 5 hp)

Solid defensive (and some offensive) scaling that can be played multiple times in one fight. Being a skill instead of a power makes it a particularly handy tool for awakened one as well. I find the dexterity to be particularly valuable, as hermit has plenty of cheap block cards to pair with it. You will definitely want to upgrade this ASAP, as 1 dexterity is pretty low impact. While this might suggest leaning into your strikes, I would advise caution going down that road. Most of the “Strike support” in hermit serves primarily as mitigation, making them less bad, rather than actually good. You will still generally want to remove your basics, but it may be less of a priority if you find ways to support them early on . Maintenance pairs particularly well with eternal form+card draw to reduce its cost and let you play multiple block cards in one turn more easily. Vantage+ and feint can imitate the synergy of silents backflip+footwork combination when played alongside maintenance.

Maintenance is one of your few ways to scale your block up as hermit (shadow cloak is the other big one), which makes it pretty desirable, as nearly every deck will need some plan to block large hits in the late game. You can cast it multiple times more easily with lone wolf and snecko eye, though I usually find that just playing maintenance+ 2 or 3 times is usually enough to get the defensive scaling I need. Actually a pretty reasonable act 1 pickup, since you will still have 4 strikes in your deck, and getting a little scaling for the act 1 boss is nice. It play well into both lagavulin and tri-sentries, but is awful into gremlin nob. Can be a great pickup in act 2, as the scaling can be part of your solution for champ, and helps immensely against hyper beam from automaton. It also does well into both awakened one and time eater in act 3. Great with 4 energy, letting you cast it more often, and more easily follow it up with block cards/strikes to use the stats immediately.
don't forget <cheat>

embeds.title: Cheat
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Play one of the top 3 (5) cards in your draw pile.
**Dead On:** Also trigger its **Dead On** effect.

messages.content: I take this to get dexterity and forget it even does anything for your strikes. You have to play this 3 times to make strikes even worth playing over normal hermit attacks and those normal attacks can be scaled much better then strikes can, so your really having to play maintenance 6 times or more to make it worth while in act 3 and onwards. Despite this being able to get at least 4 dexterity from a maintenance+  is still good for basically any deck and you can safely ignore the strike scaling entirely.

Yeah as the character with high burst damage, a slow way to scale strikes to be almost at the level of your average common attack is useless. This is repeatable dexterity and this alongside stuff like dive and vantage makes awakened one a pushover for hermit
The strike part makes this an okay pick early game
Also this is like, good dex gain i guess
Reusable footwork on upgrade
That's the main use of It, yes
Hermit has a lot of good cheap block cards, he usually has an easy time making good use of the Dex unless Its a curse build
Also the extra strike dmg helps in act 1
Since you most likely still have most of your strikes
I feel like act 1 damage is one of the few things hermit does not need any more help in though tbh, and it's also very slow.
The extra strike damage is basically nothing to me. It's practically useless.
It makes a slow card more takeable in act 1
Does really nice work on Sentries, Lagavulin and the act 1 boss, enabling you to be a little more picky on your damage commons

well, I got maintenance first pick and decided to try it out and see if it was actually good outside of strike builds... and then I got take cover from the next fight, high noon from an event, and two copies of showdown, so now I'm doing the basic card thing.

messages.content: yes but it used to be a permanent cost decrease
my hot take on lone wolf is that I should not have taken it after the form

final take on my maintenance run: pretty solid, although I found myself hurting for cards that double dip on dex. The fact that hermit has an X-cost block card that's part of the same archetype (basic cards) as maintenance and you don't get X times the dex bonus is definitely a little awkward. damage against the heart was also sorely lacking, although that has a lot to do with the strike half of the card. high noon is more fun than I thought. the deck really suffered from cutting a strike and a defend before I realized it was a basic build.
cards that double-dip on dex are rare across most characters
at least for 1 energy (since decieve reality is two 1-cost block cards)

embeds.title: Black Knight's Helm
embeds.description:
Special Relic / The Champ / Downfall

The first time you enter each **Stance** each combat:
Defensive: Gain 2 **Dexterity** :p_dexterity: and lose 1 **Strength** :p_strength:.
Berserker: Gain 2 **Strength** :p_strength: and lose 1 **Dexterity** :p_dexterity:.
*Only a flesh wound.*

messages.content: also note that 95% of the time, this is basically "start each combat with 1 str and dex"

<Second Wind>, <Backflip> (assuming it draws more block cards), <Dodge and Roll>, <Hologram> (if you recur a cheap block card), <Reinforced Body>, <Halt>, <Decieve Reality>, and <Spirit Shield> also use your dexterity bonus multiple times. Hermits main applications are with feint, body armor, and using eternal form+card draw to play several block cards very cheaply in one turn. Maintence plays very well with eternal form, both to let you cast it more often, and to more easily spam cheap block cards.
